posts.post_content:
Posted By: Cy
Hi,

I have a presentable lower-grade 1910 T212 Obak for sale (175 Subjects).

The price is $1750 delivered (This price is a joke. I would need $1750 to take a plane and deliver the card personally to you.) or if you prefer that I mail it, the price is $22.00.

The price of the card is $22 delivered by the postman.

You can send me an E-mail at cy@cyscards.com.

[IMG]http://www.cyscards.com/obak/picsb/obakjsmithb.jpg[/IMG]

Thanks.

Cy

Posted By: Steve Murray

"Hi,

I have a presentable lower-grade 1911 T212 Obak for sale (175 Subjects).

The price is $1750 delivered or if you prefer that I mail it, the price is $22.00.

You can send me an E-mail at cy@cyscards.com."

___________________________   

No intention to improperly interfere so take this as a free bump.

1. This is a 1910, not 1911; and

2. $1750 delivered seems steep. Presume that includes airfare to get it here and lodging.

Posted By: Andrew
Although the seller has the right to name their price, I'm curious as to why this is being offered for 50x+ the normal asking price?

"Take your life in your own hands and what happens? A terrible thing: no one to blame." -- Erica Jong

Posted By: Brian McQueen

Guys, I think this is just a typo.  I've worked with Cy several times before and I know he's a good guy to have on the board.  I think what he meant to say is that if you pick the card up, the price is $17.50 (NOTE:  missing decimal point above) however if you want the card shipped to you the price is $22.  

Hope that clears it up and Cy can certainly correct me if I'm guessing wrong here.

Thanks,
Brian

Posted By: Richard
Could be wrong, but I read this as just a joke.  $1750 delivered, meaning he'd bring it to your doorstep personally, but if you were satisfied with just having it mailed to you, then $22 would be enough.



Richard.

Posted By: Cy
Hello,

This is my try at making a joke. My thought was that the price would be $1750 if I deliver the card personally to you. You know, where I take a plane and hand it to you personally. I guess it's not good business to try to make humor when trying to sell a card.

People of the Net 54 board, the price of the card is:

$22

and that includes delivery. I will hand it off to the Postman rather than do the delivery myself.

I hope that helps.

And thanks, Brian, for sticking up for me. I appreciate it.

Sincerely,

Cy
www.cyscards.com
